Uses of Class
de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.api.TextSimilarityMeasureBase

  • Packages that use TextSimilarityMeasureBase 
    Package Description
    de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms
    Contains components which are fundamental for all similarity measures.
    de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.api
    This package includes the interfaces for similarity measures.
    de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.lexical.ngrams
    Contains text similarity measures that operate on character or word n-gram text representations.
    de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.lexical.string
    Contains a variety of text similarity measures that operate solely on the string representations of texts, e.g. a measure based on the longest common subsequence.
    de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.lsr
    Contains text similarity measures that are based on lexical-semantic resources such as WordNet.
    de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.lsr.aggregate
    Contains aggregation strategies which allow to aggregate the scores of term similarity measures to the text level in order to get a single overall text similarity score.
    de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.lsr.gloss
    Contains text similarity measures that are based on comparisons of the glosses of two words that are part of a given lexical-semantic resources.
    de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.lsr.path
    Contains text similarity measures that are based on comparisons of the connecting paths of two words within a given lexical-semantic resources.
    de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.ml
    Contains text similarity measures that are based on machine learning.
    de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.structure
    Contains text similarity measures that are based on structural comparisons.
    de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.style
    Contains text similarity algorithms that are based on stylistic comparisons.
    de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.vsm
    Contains text similarity measures that are based on vector comparisons, e.g.
    de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.wikipedia
    Contains text similarity measures that are based on Wikipedia, e.g. the WLM measure which operates on the hyperlinks in Wikipedia.

    • Uses of TextSimilarityMeasureBase in de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms

      Subclasses of TextSimilarityMeasureBase in de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  RandomBaselineTextSimilarityMeasure
      A random baseline measure which returns random scores in a [0,1[ interval.

    • Uses of TextSimilarityMeasureBase in de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.lexical.ngrams

      Subclasses of TextSimilarityMeasureBase in de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.lexical.ngrams 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  CharacterNGramMeasure
      Character n-gram measure as described in A.
      class  Islam2012Measure 
      class  WordNGramContainmentMeasure
      Similar to the WordNGramJaccardMeasure, but uses the containment measure by Broder (1997) to compute the n-gram overlap: Andrei Z.
      class  WordNGramJaccardMeasure
      This comparator is an n-gram similarity model which employs the Jaccard similarity coefficient.

    • Uses of TextSimilarityMeasureBase in de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.lexical.string

      Subclasses of TextSimilarityMeasureBase in de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.lexical.string 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  BoundedSubstringMatchComparator
      BoundedSubstringMatch: Returns 1.0 if the two strings to compare are exactly equal or if on of the strings starts or ends with the other string.
      class  CosineSimilarity 
      class  ExactStringMatchComparator
      ExactMatch: Returns 1.0 if the two strings to compare are exactly equal.
      class  GreedyStringTiling
      Algorithm taken from Michael J.
      class  JaroSecondStringComparator 
      class  JaroWinklerSecondStringComparator 
      class  LevenshteinComparator
      SecondString comparator fails for some texts.
      class  LevenshteinSecondStringComparator 
      class  LongestCommonSubsequenceComparator 
      class  LongestCommonSubsequenceNormComparator
      Computes the similarity between two strings based on the longest common subsequence.
      class  LongestCommonSubstringComparator 
      class  MongeElkanSecondStringComparator 
      class  SecondStringComparator_ImplBase 
      class  SimpleStringMatchComparator_ImplBase 
      class  SubstringMatchComparator
      SubstringMatch: Returns 1.0 if the two strings to compare are exactly equal or if on of the strings is completely contained in the other string.

      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  MCS06AggregateComparator
      Implements the aggregation strategy by Mihalcea et al. (2006).

    • Uses of TextSimilarityMeasureBase in de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.lsr.gloss

      Subclasses of TextSimilarityMeasureBase in de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.lsr.gloss 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  GlossOverlapComparator
      Implements the distance measure by Lesk (1986).

    • Uses of TextSimilarityMeasureBase in de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.lsr.path

      Subclasses of TextSimilarityMeasureBase in de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.lsr.path 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  JiangConrathComparator
      Implements the distance measure by JiangConrath (1997) jc(c1,c2) = IC(c1) + IC(c2) - 2* IC( lcs(c1,c2) ) Attention: we convert it into a relatedness measure by using the formula (2 - ( IC(c1) + IC(c2) - 2* IC(lcs(c1,c2)) )) / 2 We then scale it to [0,1] We use intrinisc IC instead of corpus-based IC and transform it into a similarity measure:
      class  LeacockChodorowComparator
      Implements the relatedness measure by Leacock and Chodorow (1998) lch(c1,c2) = - log(minPL(c1,c2) / 2 * depth) = log( 2*depth / minPL(c1,c2) ) minPathLength is measured in edges (original definition measures in nodes).
      class  LinComparator
      Implements the similarity measure by Lin (1998) lin(c1,c2) = 2 * ic ( lcs(c1,c2) ) / IC(c1) + IC(c2)
      class  PathBasedComparator 
      class  PathLengthComparator
      Implements the distance measure by Rada et al. (1989).
      class  ResnikComparator
      Implements the distance measure by Resnik (1995) res(c1,c2) = informationContent ( lowestCommonSubsumer(c1,c2) ) res(c1,c2) = ic ( lcs(c1,c2) ) We use intrinisc IC instead of corpus-based IC.
      class  WuPalmerComparator
      Implements the relatedness measure by Wu Palmer et al. (1994).

    • Uses of TextSimilarityMeasureBase in de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.ml

      Subclasses of TextSimilarityMeasureBase in de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.ml 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ClassifierSimilarityMeasure
      Runs a machine learning classifier on the provided test data on a model that is trained on the given training data.
      class  LinearRegressionSimilarityMeasure
      Runs a linear regression classifier on the provided test data on a model that is trained on the given training data.

    • Uses of TextSimilarityMeasureBase in de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.structure

      Subclasses of TextSimilarityMeasureBase in de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.structure 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  PosNGramContainmentMeasure
      Computes the overlap of part-of-speech n-grams using the containment measure, similarly as for the word n-grams in the WordNGramContainmentMeasure.
      class  PosNGramJaccardMeasure
      Computes the overlap of part-of-speech n-grams using the Jaccard measure, similarly as for the word n-grams in the WordNGramJaccardMeasure.
      class  StopwordNGramContainmentMeasure
      This comparator models the stopword n-gram containment measure as described in E.
      class  TokenPairDistanceMeasure
      This measure corresponds to the Composite Feature "Distance" as described in: ﻿Hatzivassiloglou, V., Klavans, J., & Eskin, E. (1999) Detecting text similarity over short passages: Exploring linguistic feature combinations via machine learning.
      class  TokenPairOrderingMeasure
      This measure corresponds to the Composite Feature "Ordering" as described in: ﻿Hatzivassiloglou, V., Klavans, J., & Eskin, E. (1999) Detecting text similarity over short passages: Exploring linguistic feature combinations via machine learning.

    • Uses of TextSimilarityMeasureBase in de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.style

      Subclasses of TextSimilarityMeasureBase in de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.style 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AvgCharactersPerTokenMeasure
      Computes the average number of characters per token.
      class  AvgTokensPerSentenceMeasure
      Computes the average number of tokens per sentence.
      class  FunctionWordFrequenciesMeasure
      This measure (Dinu and Popescu, 2009) operates on a set of function words and compares their word frequency vectors using Pearson correlation.
      class  MTLDComparator
      This measure computes the measure of textual lexical diversity (MTLD) for both texts, and compares them as follows: distance(T_1,T_2) = |ttr(T_1) - ttr(T_2)| MTLD is described here: P.
      class  SentenceRatioComparator
      This measure computes the ratio of number of sentences in the suspicious text compared to the number of sentences in the original text: sim(T_1,T_2) = no_sentences(T_1) / no_sentences(T_2)
      class  TokenRatioComparator
      This measure computes the ratio of number of tokens in the suspicious text compared to the number of tokens in the original text: sim(T_1,T_2) = no_tokens(T_1) / no_tokens(T_2)
      class  TypeTokenRatioComparator
      This measure computes TTR for both texts, and compares them as follows: sim(T_1,T_2) = 1 - |ttr(T_1) - ttr(T_2)|

    • Uses of TextSimilarityMeasureBase in de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.vsm

      Subclasses of TextSimilarityMeasureBase in de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.vsm 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ExplicitSemanticAnalysisComparator
      Convenience comparator that uses the more flexible VectorComparator
      in order to reimplement ESA as closely as possible.
      class  VectorComparator
      Compare two texts or terms represented by vectors.

    • Uses of TextSimilarityMeasureBase in de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.wikipedia

      Subclasses of TextSimilarityMeasureBase in de.tudarmstadt.ukp.similarity.algorithms.wikipedia 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  WikipediaBasedComparator
      WikipediaBasedComparators do not use the LSR interface, but are only LSR compatible wrappers for the measures implemented in JWPL.
      class  WLMComparator
      Wraps the Wikipedia Link Measure from David Milne.
